data.title: playtest: building placement preview not centered around mouse cursor
data.body:
In all three mods in the playtest 20170902 the building preview "attaches" to the mouse on the lower center(right) corner. In the release it was allways the center(right)-most cell.

Example PP release | playtest (C=cursor):
XX | XX
XC | XX
XX | XC

Example temple of nod  release | playtest (C=cursor):
XXX | XXX 
XCX | XXX 
XXX | XCX

data.title: Refactor low power/manual power-down actor disabling
data.body:
This aims to remove the biggest remaining roadblock towards getting rid of Actor.Disabled and the IDisable interface.

The idea is to no longer disable the actor as such, but only the traits that need to be disabled, via a condition (or multiple conditions) granted either at specific power levels (usually anything below Normal) or manual power down.

data.title: Added large blue tib crystals to Hot Springs

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
I just tested the map in the original and noticed it had these blue tib spawning large crystals of the 'remapable' variant (`BIGBLUE`), so I added them.

I also noticed our custom, fixed sprite (with shadow) doesn't need the Y axis shift, so I fixed that, too.

data.title: Make INotifyIdle, INotifyBecomingIdle & ITick require explicit implementation
data.body:
We should finish what we started at some point, and to do that we need to actually bother making some headway on this matter.

This PR finishes the job on the two `Idle` interfaces and the very common `ITick` interface.

Reviewing commit by commit is recommended, most of the stuff is simple, but going commit by commit makes the diff more readable.

data.title: Remove TargetLocation and TargetActor from order issuing code.
data.body:
Teaching actors how to properly behave when ordered to interact with frozen actors is a prerequisite for TS (#11265 is a major issue for cloak generators), and something we'd like to fix in general for the next release.  This is tricky right now because the Order class was never taught about Target, and frozen actor targeting is a bolted on kludge.

This PR starts the fixing this by introducing a new `Order` constructor that accepts a `Target`, and migrating all order issuing to use it.  Future PRs will push this through serialization/deserialization and then order resolving.

Once this is complete we will be able to implement the changes from #13363 across several smaller (and more reviewable) PRs by porting traits/activities from `ResolveFrozenActorOrder` to the native `Order.Target` on an activity-by-activity basis.

data.title: Remove dead WSB from Refinery trait
data.body:
WithSpriteBody code in Refinery trait seems to be dead. It shouldn't be in Refinery trait anyway in today's ORA standards and instead be separated to WithDockAnimation or something, which is non-existent as of now. (There's WithDockingOVERLAY though, used in bundled TS mod).

This piece of code gets in the way of having multiple WithSpriteBody traits on Refineries.

data.title: TiberianSunRefinery not needed in the future?
data.body:
From #13721 :
> And I came to a conclusion that it is the activity that knows what to do when docking, not the client/host actors. For example, if I ordered an MNLY to dock at a FIX it should move to the rally point after reloading and repairing. On the other hand, if it was laying mines and it came back to the dock to reload, it should reload and continue to lay the mines.

If this discussion is accepted, then TiberianSunRefinery should be deleted, as it only provides the dock sequence, which is what VoxelHarvester should know better.

This change will allow mixing voxel and non-voxel harvesters to dock at a refinery.

data.title: Move several interfaces to Mods.Common.
data.body: #13916 and #13732 want to extend the `IMove` interface in ways which are reasonable in themselves, but expose concepts that we don't want the engine to have to know about.  On closer inspection, all the code that cares about `IMove` has already been migrated to mod code, so this offers a cleaner solution for those and other future PRs.

data.title: Fix water splashes on bridge in RA
data.body:
On bleed, both the explosion as well as the water splash warhead of weapons triggered on bridges, since they have both the Ground and Water target types.

Ground cannot be made invalid for water splashes without causing regressions elsewhere, so a new Bridge target type is introduced to explicitly make bridges invalid targets for water splash effect warheads.

Fixes #13989.

data.title: Exact placement of overlays on cliff tiles is impossible
data.body: We opted for making terrain overlays https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13929 actors that have to be manually placed using the map editor. They need a proper footprint for enter logic (terrain tunnels) and frozen/hidden under fog mechanics https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13932#discussion_r136714790 for overlay animations. That currently makes placement twitchy as it jumps multiple cells when placing on cliffs which span over multiple elevation levels. Currently cliff overlay actor positions need 1x1 building layouts as a workaround or fine tuning in the `map.yaml`, which is very inconvenient.

Why all of a sudden nothing is working correctly!

data.title: Auto-generate a wiki page (or individual pages) detailing utility commands (args, usage, purpose, etc)
Added ScreenMap support for common sprite effects
data.body:
This adds the `ScreenMap` plumbing for sprite `IEffect`s (which can later be used for other `IEffect`s as well) and adapts all the easy sprite effects.

The only one of real importance here will be `SpriteEffect`, as it's used in `LeavesTrails`, projectile sprite trails and explosions, as well as a few other places.

The other migrated effects will likely give no noticable performance gains, but I migrated them as well since they were similarly easy to adapt and just might save a tiny additional bit of render time here and there.

Note about effects not touched by this PR:
- Support for `IEffectAboveShroud` effects would seemingly require some more changes to `WorldRenderer` (if at all possible) for presumably low gains (compared to `SpriteEffect`), so a decision and possible implementation is deferred to the future.
- System-drawn effects like contrails and beams, as well as special cases like TeslaZaps, and therefore most projectiles will possibly require some more low-level preparations and for that reason are left to a later follow-up, although they are definitely desired due to expected gains comparable to (or larger than) `SpriteEffect` in mods with considerable use of these.

Supersedes #11676.
Partially adresses #9443.

data.title: Rework global and world hotkeys
data.body:
Hardcoding global hotkeys in the static order handling plumbing is fundamentally incompatible with the future mod-defined hotkey system: it is too low level to be exposed to mod code or to the linter.  Fortunately we already have a pattern for mod-defined global hotkeys, as used by the music player.

This PR migrates the screenshot and mute (which previously only worked ingame) hotkeys to this new system, and removes the `DevReloadChrome` and `HideUserInterface` hotkeys.  These latter two are hacks that don't (and shouldn't!) work from mod code, so they can't easily be made to work with the new system.  Since they are both niche features that don't have (in my opinion) compelling use cases I felt that it was better to remove them than to let them stop progress towards the hotkey improvements.

data.title: Merge some Aircraft activities - part 1
data.body:
Merging some previously Heli-only and Plane-only activities not only makes for less activities to consider and maintain when updating or introducing features, it also will have the neat side-effect of unifying some behavior and making some existing features type-independent.

~This PR makes `CanHover` and `VTOL truly` independent from each other, allowing any combination of them without negative side-effects, and makes `TakeoffSound` independent of takeoff type.~

~The merger of the `ReturnToBase` activities also serves as preparation for further sanitizing and unifying the return behavior in a future follow-up.~

~Enables `VTOL` on TS Banshee and Orca Bomber as test-case for mixing `VTOL: true` with `CanHover: false`.~

The crossed-though features will come in follow-up PRs.
